bibl.title: Military Orders for Newell R. Colby, November 2, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #74 directs Colby to the board of medical officers to determine his fitness for the position of acting hospital steward. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Newell R. Colby, November 2, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE
DEC 3 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. NOV 13 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 247 A

HEADQUARTERS DEPT. OF WESTERN CUBA,
Quemados, November 2, 1900.

Private Newell R. Colby, Hospital Corps, U. S. Army,
will, pursuant to instructions from Headquarters Division
of Cuba, dated November 1, 1900, report to the board of
medical officers convened by Special Orders No. 66, c. s.,
these headquarters, at such times as his presence may be
required, for the purpose of examination to determine his
fitness for the position of acting hospital steward, U. S.
Army.

BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:
R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
